title:PandaPaxxy MKB Perks - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.


// Forbearance
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "While I, personally, am glad Forbearance is easier to get, I also understand why there's community hesitation against it. If you already have a Forbearance crafted or Adept, you definitely do not need to grind out the new version other than for progress towards Superblack. If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Forbearance
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. Wellspring could pair well with Demolitionist for even more ability energy, or Desperate Measures for a damage bonus without needing a weapon kill to start." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=3523296417,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2109543898,3523296417

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi’s Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=2010801679,469285294

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=469285294,951095735
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=438098033,951095735
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,469285294
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,438098033


// Edge Transit
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3078487919,3751912585
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3194351027,3751912585
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3078487919,968510818
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3194351027,968510818
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2396489472,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2396489472,3194351027


// Edge Transit
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "The extra health added with the 7.3.5 update made a big switch to heavy grenade launcher perks. Now you'll need to invest heavier into Blast Radius to hit around 65+ in order to reliably OHK a guardian of all resilience levels. Volatile Launch with a Blast Radius MW gets us to 75, High-Explosive Ordinance brings that up to 85 and evens out the hit to velocity from Volatile Launch. Paired up with Impulse Amplifier and you'll hardly notice a difference compared to a max velocity roll without Impulse Amplifier. With the perk shake up I'd personally take Explosive Light in the fourth column to bring the blast radius up to 100 and get some extra explosion damage but Destabilizing Rounds is also good if you're looking for a pseudo-Chain Reaction." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3194351027,951095735
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2048641572,951095735
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3194351027,3751912585
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2048641572,3751912585
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2396489472,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=2048641572,2396489472


// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=1820235745,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=1820235745,3081867624
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=1820235745,2109543898

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse’s defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Hung Jury SR4
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "If you liked Explosive Payload and missed it on S14 and S19 you can grab that, or One for All that was only on S14’s perk pool. Kinetic Tremors also moved to column 3 allowing you to stack two damage perks! Rewind Rounds might be better if you're using Hung Jury as your primary and taking down wave after wave of enemies, pair that with Firefly for AoE damage and you will seldom reload. If you liked some of the older perks like Adrenaline Junkie you'll be better off keeping your older version." Recommended MW: Stability|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hung Jury SR4
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Speaking of the crucible the curated roll is almost perfect, if you don't like Enlightened Action you could instead opt for No Distractions or Rapid Hit. Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the “gimmick” of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=3708227201,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=3078487919,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=2048641572,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=1546637391,3708227201

// Falling Guillotine
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP we could see an uptick in sword usage. Falling Guillotine is the only sword in the game to get both Eager Edge and Chain Reaction, for you to zoom in and get a multikill off of one sword swing. I don't think there will be a better sword for PvP. Potentially the Half-Truths with the unique combination of Eager Edge and Tireless Blades for the best ammo efficiency." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=2077819806,2396489472


// Hammerhead
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your “damage” perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=3418782618,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=3418782618,557221067
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=2109543898,3418782618
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1354429876,95528736

dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=2109543898,968510818


// Hammerhead
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over on the PvP side, machine guns haven't been high meta but they have always felt good. Hammerhead with Rewind Rounds and High-Impact Reserves will synergize well with the low ammo from the wall, and refund itself to get you a few more kills. If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. Over-Under is another good shout here to get rid of most players in rifts. I wouldn't mind hearing more Hammerheads in the crucible. At least I'd know where they are." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=3418782618,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=3418782618,557221067

dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1870851715,557221067
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1870851715,2213355989


// Whisper of the Worm
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Whisper is back and craftable. What seems to be the best perks for our dear friend Xol, Will of Thousands? Arrowhead Brake is the best in slot for making the recoil direction vertical, but if you don't need that, Corkscrew Rifling or Fluted Barrel for the added stats. Bungie decided against magazine extending perks so the best here is Flared Magwell for when you miss and need to reload. Alloy Mag is great if you do run out of ammo and need to reload before another boss fight or after a wipe. In the third column Field Prep brings up the already buffed reserves while also making reloading faster when crouched. The final column are the stocks and Short-Action Stock is the best for the added handling, if you didn't slot in Arrowhead Brake and still want the recoil direction bumped up you could instead go for Fitted Stock."|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1983149589&perks=3732232161,777589559
dimwishlist:item=1983149589&perks=3732232161,777589556
dimwishlist:item=1983149589&perks=3732232161,777589557


// Whisper of the Worm
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "If you wanted to take Whisper into PvP bump up the handling via Fluted Barrel and Short-Action Stock. Field Prep also gives a handling bonus when crouched and Accurized Rounds will also bump up your range."|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1983149589&perks=3337692349,3732232161
dimwishlist:item=1983149589&perks=3732232161,777589559


// Blast Furnace
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Blast Furnace is probably the best feeling 450 aggressive frame pulse. Personally I liked the Meyrin RDL scope as it highlighted targets, but I can understand it wasn't everyone's cup of tea. The best combo that I will be farming for will be Kinetic Tremors and Firefly for AoE on top of AoE. Keep Away also serves as a good reload perk, while also making it easier to get yellow numbers. Shoot to Loot combined with Firefly will allow you to pick up orbs and ammo from afar." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Blast Furnace
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later). Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Elsie's Rifle
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Elsie's Rifle is a throwback to D1, and another good weapon Bungie could have brought back was Murmur, the element switching fusion *from the Moon.* Jokes aside, Elsie's Rifle is incredible. Rewind Rounds or Feeding Frenzy paired with Desperate Measures or Desperado, any combination of the above will be more than lethal. Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Elsie's Rifle
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Like I mentioned earlier, Arrowhead Brake is a must have. This will make your two bursts far easier. Zen Moment and Headseeker allow you consistent two bursts. Depending on how that feels you might instead want Keep Away for better accuracy from a distance. Zen Moment and Kill Clip are also present, giving you some flexibility if you don't like Blast Furnace or aggressive burst pulse rifles." Recommended MW: Stability or Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more “on demand” perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=3824105627,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=3824105627,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=2109543898,3824105627

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Succession
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in the crucible snipers have taken a hit. Not only did they get harder to use with an aim assist nerf, but the ammo economy shifting makes it feel as if you're never getting ammo. In order to make the most use of Succession you'll need high handling alongside Snapshot Sights. Then you can choose your column 3 perk from Moving Target for added aim assist and strafe speed when ADS, or Firmly Planted for better accuracy and a slight handling bump when crouched." // Outbreak Perfected
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I remember the OG quest for Outbreak Prime. What a fun time. Outbreak Perfected has truly been perfected with crafting. Arrowhead Brake does improve the recoil but Outbreak Perfected has “auto rifle” recoil making the bounce a lot less intense. Bumping up the magazine with Appended Mag or Tactical Mag is preferred for more shots, but Flared Magwell for a bump in stability and reload will also feel nice. Rewind Rounds is the best perk in slot especially if the nanites count towards the bullets back. Rapid Hit or Outlaw are also great for just adding stability and reload. Short-Action Stock brings up the handling."|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Outbreak Perfected
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you would like to bring the nanites into PvP I would opt for one of two ways. Arrowhead Brake at the front end for added recoil direction, Accurized Rounds for the extra range. Headseeker or Rapid Hit depending on what you value, and your choice of Short-Action Stock for more handling or Hand-Laid Stock for the most stability. The alternative way is with Fitted Stock to bring you right up to 100 recoil direction meaning you can slot in Smallbore or even Hammer-Forged Rifling for more range. You drop some handling unless you make that up in your barrel."|tags:pvp,mkb

// Edge Transit (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." // Edge Transit (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "The extra health added with the 7.3.5 update made a big switch to heavy grenade launcher perks. Now you'll need to invest heavier into Blast Radius to hit around 65+ in order to reliably OHK a guardian of all resilience levels. Volatile Launch with a Blast Radius MW gets us to 75, High-Explosive Ordinance brings that up to 85 and evens out the hit to velocity from Volatile Launch. Paired up with Impulse Amplifier and you'll hardly notice a difference compared to a max velocity roll without Impulse Amplifier. With the perk shake up I'd personally take Explosive Light in the fourth column to bring the blast radius up to 100 and get some extra explosion damage but Destabilizing Rounds is also good if you're looking for a pseudo-Chain Reaction." // The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." // Hammerhead (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your “damage” perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Hammerhead (Holofoil)

If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. // Blast Furnace (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later). Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues." // Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more “on demand” perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=3824105627,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=3824105627,4049631843

// Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Succession (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in the crucible snipers have taken a hit. Not only did they get harder to use with an aim assist nerf, but the ammo economy shifting makes it feel as if you're never getting ammo. In order to make the most use of Succession you'll need high handling alongside Snapshot Sights. Then you can choose your column 3 perk from Moving Target for added aim assist and strafe speed when ADS, or Firmly Planted for better accuracy and a slight handling bump when crouched." The issue I have with this is that Darkest Before is a rapid-fire frame, meaning it does really low damage per shot. Sometimes needing two or even three bursts for a red bar. Almost any other frame would be incredible. What a shame." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Wild Style
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won’t even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you’re looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you’re committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable." // Wild Style
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Wild Style and by extension all double-fire grenade launchers have one limiting factor, and that is that it fires two shots at once. If your one grenade bounces away you lose half your damage. With Bungie’s architecture it happens more often than not. Disorienting Grenades will allow you to still blind even if one goes away, and High-Velocity Rounds will keep your arc tighter to make bounces less punishing (if you’re not purposefully bouncing shots)." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1332123064&perks=3619207468,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=1332123064&perks=3324494224,3619207468

// Wild Style (Adept)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am glad to see more obtainable double-fire grenade launchers. Wilderflight is great, but being locked behind a dungeon means most players won’t even see it drop. Being a Vanguard reward allows more players to obtain it, and I love that as the double-fire is a very fun and interesting option within our ever-expanding arsenal. For PvE you’re looking for the tried and true Envious Assassin, this paired with Incandescent will clear rooms and deal some great damage against bosses. Unrelenting is a great option if you’re committing to using Wild Style as your main weapon, the extra healing plus synergy with Solar verbs will make you unkillable." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=959037361&perks=4293542123,968510818

// Wild Style (Adept)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Wild Style and by extension all double-fire grenade launchers have one limiting factor, and that is that it fires two shots at once. If your one grenade bounces away you lose half your damage. With Bungie’s architecture it happens more often than not. Disorienting Grenades will allow you to still blind even if one goes away, and High-Velocity Rounds will keep your arc tighter to make bounces less punishing (if you’re not purposefully bouncing shots)." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=959037361&perks=3619207468,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=959037361&perks=3324494224,3619207468

dimwishlist:item=959037361&perks=3324494224,3828510309


// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. You can opt for a Heal Clip roll to keep yourself alive, a Target Lock roll to take down champions and larger health enemies, or even an Onslaught roll to tear into waves of adds with the damage of an auto but the speed of an SMG. Take your pick. If you’re going Heal Clip I would recommend Incandescent. Target Lock will work best with Overflow and Onslaught with Subsistence. You can mix and match to your heart’s content, but those are my recommendations." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1820994983&perks=3017780555,4293542123

// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "PvP has far less options but still some solid options. Instead of different niches within the grand scheme of PvE content, we really have consistency or lethality 2x. Within both you’ll find a healthy scoop of stability perks, either Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Perpetual Motion. Pick your poison there. If you want more consistency on top of your consistency sundae, go for Tap the Trigger. For lethality you can opt for Target Lock, Onslaught, or the tried and true Kill Clip. All options are great but work in different ways, your best option might not be the same as others so give them a try." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "New DMT-lite? Heck yeah. Let’s Yee to the Haw. No but you can stack enough reload through your masterwork, Keep Away, and Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to not need it. Precision Instrument will be great as the reload will allow you to keep up high stacks. Headstone works will being a scout and a high-damage frame." // Judgment
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Judgment lost a little bit of its edge in the crucible. You can still get Slideshot and Opening Shot. It’s not that Judgment is bad, just that other weapons edged it out and 140’s aren’t exactly strong in this meta (for the first time in a while). Hitmark HCS, SteadyHand HCS, or FastDraw HCS are all great options and allow you to add some much needed stats and aim assist. I am surprised Bungie didn’t swap Judgment over to barrels. I guess hand cannon sights are easier than “sights” if that makes sense." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

Multimach is no exception. Frenzy will give you the easiest damage bonus and increase our reload speed. // Multimach CCX
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Multimach is back and boy do I have conflicting views on this. Should we invest in lethality or consistency? Iron Reach will be incredible in 3v3 game modes, as well as Trials and potentially in Rumble, but Kill Clip will be even better for 6v6 game modes or slayers. Ideally you’ll find a healthy mix of range and stability, but Dynamic Sway Reduction will cover most of your stability if you opt for Iron Reach. If you prefer Kill Clip, then I would recommend Moving Target for better movement speed and being that quick slayer we all know you are." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Prosecutor
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Dragonfly and Voltshot is an incredibly unique combination. Dragonfly doesn’t extend the Voltshot radius, but extra boom and zap does clear a room faster than one or the other. If you’re looking for a more neutral weapon, I’d say that Rewind Rounds and Target Lock will be your best options for taking down majors with ease. Prosecutor isn’t ideal for PvE, but we’re all here for the PvP review." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// A Sudden Death
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A Sudden Death is not a great shotgun for PvE, while you do have Envious Assassin and One-Two Punch which together allow you to never worry about reloading, I find rapid-fire frames at the opposite end of the shotgun spectrum better for One-Two Punch. Trench Barrel and Grave Robber are great combinations for “maining” this shotgun but an even better combination would be Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace, the issue with this combo is that it’s a shotgun and not a primary ammo weapon." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Taraxippos
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "With the update to scout rifle damage, I think there’s a good case for this scout being a low-key meta choice. I love kill clip for really deleting guardians in 6s, but it falls off hard in 3s." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Tigerspite now has a better glow-up for PvP. // Twilight Oath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Similarly to Retold Tale, Twilight Oath has PvE perks but not the best position. Rapid-fire frame snipers are hard to utilize at max RPM and require a hard pull down to keep on target. With the crit box shrinking on some bosses and champions doing what champions want to do, it will be hard to continuously hit crits at max RPM. Otherwise it’s a pretty solid general use sniper." // Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don’t kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don’t really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you’ll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Waking Vigil
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Let’s talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. While we still have some great perks going on currently, Waking Vigil is just a relic from the past." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sleepless
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Sleepless is an interesting rocket. It was great when rockets could be used everywhere and when we didn’t have to reload via Lunafaction Boots or Rally Barricades. Currently you’ll find very limited uses out of most rockets. There are a few options that have risen to the top, but it means most rockets are going to fall into general utility tools. Sleepless has Chain Reaction for better add clear, and Auto-Loading Holster for quality of life. You might be able to squeeze out some solid DPS with Field Prep but without a good damage perk you’ll fall behind almost immediately." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sleepless
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Crucible rockets need one thing, a great blast radius. Sleepless has that in droves. With a blast radius masterwork you’ll sit at 100 even, that way you can invest your other perks into velocity and handling, bringing up some of its lower stats. With Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds you’re looking at a nice 60 velocity. It won’t beat Impulse Amplifier for the quickest rocket but it will move. Chain Reaction then becomes great for dealing with multiple guardians in every gamemode." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Being a stasis trace rifle already gives Appetence viability in a lot of loadouts. No longer are you tied to Ager’s Scepter for a “kinetic” trace rifle. Appetence is also legendary so you open up a plethora of loadout possibilities. In PvE you can make the most of this trace rifle with Overflow and Killing Tally for a 21% Delirium-lite. Being able to walk over bricks of special to double the magazine capacity keeps Killing Tally primed and ready to rip into any wave of enemy you might have in front of you. If you prefer a more calculated approach or don’t want to use just one weapon, Headstone is extremely strong with the buffed Stasis subclasses." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Taking Appetence into the crucible might be a big test of your patience. Already having low ammo, and the current economy of ammo bricks will severely limit your overall usage. If you can horde ammo bricks like Scrooge you can certainly make this weapon work better. Enlightened Action will make the weapon feel better, and Headstone can deny revives or build into the Stasis subclass like in PvE. Killing Tally can work if you use nothing but this trace rifle but I wouldn’t advise it." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh hey, a new strand fusion rifle. Will Scatter Signal be better than Pressurized Precision? Well neither are great as Strand fusion rifles. But for a “Kinetic” fusion rifle I think Scatter Signal rivals and possibly beats out Riptide for best in slot fusion. Overflow and Controlled Burst for added damage throughout the magazine. You’ll only need one magazine booster to hit the fusion cap of 8 shots or you can opt for an even faster firing fusion with Accelerated Coils. Overflow will double your magazine capacity giving you 16 shots, 15 of which will have an extra 20% damage increase. If you opt for Extended Battery for the 16 total shots you can slot in Major or Boss spec for an additional 7.77% damage to every shot." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=2594592626,3643424744

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP there’s not a lot that can convince me that rapid-fire frame fusion rifles are anything other than anti-shotgun weapons. The “Uno Reverse” of the Destiny weapons. Scatter Signal doesn’t really lean into the anti-ape role but it does have a few tricks up its metaphorical sleeve in Kickstart for the most ape fusion we can get. Lower the charge time as low as it can go or just throw on Kickstart for extra damage and speedier shots. I’d pair that with Perpetual Motion for the bonuses to stability and handling. This way the rest of your perks can be invested into range." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Supercluster
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Slug shotguns are not nearly as dominant as they used to be. That’s really all you’re going to need. Invest the rest of your stats into whatever you feel like you’ll need more. // Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Adhortative is an adaptive solar pulse rifle most similar to Forge’s Pledge. Adhortative has better range, handling, and recoil direction, while losing in stability, reload speed and airborne effectiveness. Either pulse is only better than the other by less than 3 points in each category, except for airborne effectiveness and recoil direction, 9 and 10 respectively. Between these two for PvE, Adhortative wins purely for having a reload perk in Feeding Frenzy. If you don’t care about that, either can work." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "With such a similar pulse existing in PvP it comes down to perks. Forge’s Pledge gets access to Accurized and Steady Rounds, while Adhortative comes with High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds. Forge’s Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. Depending on your preferred play style you might prefer one over the other, but I cannot emphasize this enough: both can work wonders." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Lethophobia is defined as an abnormal anxiety of forgetting. Let’s hope you don’t forget the god rolls of this bow then. As with most PvE bows you’re looking for a good combination of draw time and accuracy. Successful Warm-Up gives you a better draw time post-defeat, but has a bit less utility against higher health enemies. Explosive Head can stagger those arrow sponges a bit easier but having Rapid Hit or Archer’s Tempo there would have been preferred. Disruption break will work best in conjunction with a high damage kinetic weapon like this season's Supercluster slug shotgun. Golden Tricorn will feel great on a combination of subclasses this season with Permeability changing this weapons damage type from void to your selected subclass. You can run a full void or full strand or stasis loadout without much thought. Just remember that the damage change goes away when you stow this weapon." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Precision frame hand cannons have not had their time in the spotlight for a while. Outside of the Seventh Seraph Officer’s Revolver paired with Lucky Pants there are not many reasons to use a precision frame hand cannon. If you run void subclasses a lot you can take advantage of Golden Tricorn to maximize damage, making these fast firing hand cannons feel way more chunky than they normally are. Rapid Hit will also bring up the already decent reload speed and their exceptional stability. If you feel like you need more range in PvE (which is an already odd thing to task for) you can opt for Keep Away for a continuous reload speed buff and a touch more range." // Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna’s Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it’s not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought)." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Subjunctive
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Subjunctive was the smg that could. It felt great in PvE and held its own back when recluse dominated all aspects of our life. Oh how naive we were. When Rampage and Outlaw were all we cared about. Things have shifted and more weapons are certainly popular. The only true competition Subjunctive needs to worry about is the Ikelos SMG. Both are arc, but what gives Subjunctive the edge? Golden Tricorn. It’s not the highest uptime on Arc but you can chain back to back arc ability kills with some loadouts, this will give Subjunctive a 1.5x damage bonus over the Ikelos (this is without giving the Ikelos a damage perk of its own). Most players spec’ed into Voltshot which will clear rooms easier but have slight difficulties taking down beefier targets. With Golden Tricorn 2x you’ll have enough damage to look at enemies and they’ll become unalive from sheer admiration, and you’ll be able to chunk down majors with ease, Subsistence just keeps the chains rolling." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This season’s Competitive weapon. Belisarius-D is already making waves as one of the strongest pulse rifles with a ton of combinations. It might not be as good as pre-nerf No Time to Explain, but it certainly holds its own in our current Meta. Arrowhead isn’t necessary with our deterministic recoil, but I found the bursts a bit tighter and easier to control. I like that Vorpal Weapon can be paired with Kill Clip for extra damage against majors and champions. Rapid Hit is a better neutral perk for cleaning up the burst and adding much needed reload speed." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=247725512,3993379141
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=3619207468,3993379141


// Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Belisarius-D comes from the crucible, and it belongs in the crucible. Rapid Hit and Headseeker are fantastic neutral perks that no one would argue belong together. Keep Away and Moving Target can substitute as well for a very strong neutral weapon. Eye of the Storm is conditional in that you will have to take damage, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks. In the crucible you will be taking damage, so getting some extra benefits alongside that is all upsides. Kill Clip doesn’t change the time to kill enough to be noticeable unless you hit nothing but headshots. In which case you’ll drop down to a 0.60 TtK with 6 crits on Tier 8 Resilience or below. Without Kill Clip on those higher tiered resilience levels you’ll need 1 extra bullet, either way it still remains a two-burst as you won’t stop the burst mid-burst." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=247725512,460017080
dimwishlist:item=2313726158&perks=3619207468,460017080

// Retrofuturist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Retrofuturist is an interesting addition this season. Alongside Riiswalker we have a kinetic option for a lightweight frame shotgun. Retrofuturist was never a truly strong pick for PvE and that remains for this current version. Auto-Loading Holster will be your best quality of life perk, and paired with Vorpal Weapon is a very cookie-cutter shotgun. Destabilizing Rounds pairs best with Feeding Frenzy to use Retrofuturist as your primary add-clearing weapon." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Retrofuturist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller / M+KB): "If you like snappy shotguns you will be happy to learn that Retrofuturist gets access to Quickdraw and Snapshot Sights. I prefer Slickdraw as shotgun aim assist doesn’t feel incredibly strong to me, but I also don’t mind lower AA weapons in general. Having a fast shotgun is more important to me, your mileage may vary with that. I think most players will opt for the tried and true Quickdraw and Snapshot Sights." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=1612781792&perks=1821614984,957782887

dimwishlist:item=1612781792&perks=1546637391,706527188
dimwishlist:item=1612781792&perks=1546637391,1866048759


// Chivalric Fire
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Our full ritual playlist weapon is an interesting one. Caster frame swords have not been strong since their introduction. So Bungie is either testing us to see if they should buff caster frames or trying to get more hands on feedback. I feel like caster frames are a tough one to balance. Give them too much damage and they become an extremely safe pick in everyday play. Lower the ammo requirements and you will inadvertently buff their DPS as you’ll have more opportunities to use the heavy attack. Lower their charge time to counterbalance either of those changes and we’re back to square one. Chivalric Fire is a great neutral sword that works best on Void subclasses, but you can utilize either orb generation or volatility to great success without committing to Void." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=1749209109,243981275
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=243981275,776531651
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=1749209109,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=2048641572,776531651

// Lethal Abundance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Lethal Abundance has one thing going for it, being a Strand high-impact frame auto rifle. Slice and Hatchling both give this weapon extra Strand utility, but on other subclasses this weapon feels like any generic high-impact auto rifle. Enlightened Action and Keep Away both bump up your reload speed, either organically or passively, respectively. Target Lock works best on beefier targets, but can also help on rank and file enemies. Hatchling works best when paired with Strand. Onslaught might be the best neutral perk, but if you want a faster firing auto rifle, just use any of the other Strand auto." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

Slice is looking like the best option for most players in the third column, so having a bit of added stability or better lethality will depend on the players." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Riiswalker
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Riiswalker is an interesting weapon. A Fallen-forged weapon that can be used against the Fallen. Oh how the turns have tabled. Discord and Vorpal Weapon are going to be my top picks for keeping your magazine loaded and for extra damage against majors. It will not be better than more defined picks, but it will be strong in less focused strikes and low-end PvE." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Riiswalker
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "If you never grinded out your Wastelander patterns like me, this could be your next best option. Riiswalker was always my favorite lightweight shotgun and this version comes with the same great stat package with a potential 100 range. The one thing that separated it from Wastelander was the lack of Opening Shot, this version comes with Opening Shot, and Slideshot for the coveted 100 range. With all the investments into range your barrel and masterwork should be geared towards handling." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Undercurrent
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Forbearance, Salvager’s Salvo, or Undercurrent. Which is going to reign supreme? Probably Forbearance. But Undercurrent is a decent attempt. Voltshot isn’t as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Bait and Switch is interesting for keeping up damage but not having a reliable magazine overflow perk hurts a bit more. Ambitious Assassin is great, but Envious is better. Overall I’d say it’s a neat addition but you wouldn’t be too hurt not having it if you already have Forbearance or Salvo." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Incisor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn’t nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren’t perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Incisor (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn’t nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren’t perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Naeem's Lance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Naren’s Lance is an interesting weapon. It’s not quite dead on arrival, but it doesn’t do any one thing particularly well. Reconstruction and Precision Instrument are great paired with the rapid fire frame, allowing a ton of shots fired with increased damage. But then it falls in that it’s a rapid fire frame and firing at 140 RPM while maintaining full crits is extremely difficult." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Naeem's Lance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in the crucible it also lags behind without two of the most important perks. Opening Shot or Snapshot Sights, and while you can get away without either of those perks and still see success, you’ll have to find handling and accuracy perks elsewhere. Keep Away is fantastic for reducing your accuracy cone, and Elemental Capacitor could bump you up to 100 handling with an arc subclass. I don’t think many players will opt for this sniper but you can make it work." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Vengeful Whisper
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I’m happy for more variants of weapons. Vengeful Whisper being a strand bow opens up some loadout flexibility and covers your strand subclass verbs. It’s less useful without Match Game but it can still be useful for taking out shields faster. Archer’s Tempo is fantastic on bows for lowering successive draw times, and Precision Instrument fits nicely as you’ll want to hit those crits, the draw time allowing you a bit of forgiveness lining up those crit shots. You could even switch it up and go with Explosive Payload and Successful Warm-Up if you’re using this in lower and PvE where you can one shot everything to keep Successful Warm-Up going." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Indebted Kindness
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This sidearm is the reason why this breakdown took so long. I cannot wrap my head around it and it took me a while to get rolls I wanted to test. Beacon Rounds are incredible, it turns into a mini-tracking rocket. A beefier Dreg’s Promise if you remember. Impulse Amplifier gives you a near hit scan weapon. Voltshot turns Indebted Kindness into a pocket Trinity Ghoul with a beefier per shot damage profile." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Indebted Kindness
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Indebted Kindness is extremely interesting in the crucible. Impulse Amplifier can turn this into a near instant pseudo-grenade launcher shot, but I think most players are going to opt for Beacon Rounds for better tracking and hip-fire usage. The tracking isn’t incredible side to side, for when a Dawnblade flies across your screen, but for general strafing the tracking at low levels is great. At higher buffs you can start to get into a groove and be a bit more loose with your aim, but I wouldn’t rely heavily on the tracking. Adagio makes Indebted Kindness a reliable two shot, which I think feeds well into Beacon Rounds." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=2859149211,3673922083
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=3673922083,951095735
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=3673922083,3828510309


// Dragoncult Sickle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Dragoncult Sickle is our last dungeon weapon. Being a strand caster frame might actually benefit the toolkit a bit more. Being able to spread Sever through Slice and Chain Reaction or spawn Threadlings from a distance makes this weapon an incredibly strong addition to an all Strand loadout. It might not be the best for boss damage or the best for add clear, but I think it will find a nice home in some Strand loadouts." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Dragoncult Sickle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Dragoncult Sickle might have some utility in PvE but PvP is not as forgiving. Assassin’s Blade allows you to run a bit faster when you get a kill, and chain reaction will allow you to get some cheeky double kills or team wipes. I like the idea of caster frames in PvP but in practice you’re better of using another sword." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Horror Story
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "So Horror Story is stasis now. Kinda cool, but not the biggest draw. The combo I'm looking for is Enlightened Action and Target Lock. The two of them together give you bonus handling, reload, and damage. As long as you're connecting shots you'll get the benefits of both!" Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=177568179&perks=365154968,3828510309


// Horror Story
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP you could swap out Enlightened Action for Dynamic Sway Reduction or maybe even Demolitionist. But I'd say that the handling bonus will feel really nice. A base of 37 handling isn't ideal, so the slight bonus from Arrowhead Brake coupled with Enlightened Action will make this auto rifle feel more like an SMG." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Jurassic Green
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Both rolls for PvP are very similar except for two differences in stat investments. On controller you'll want a bit more stability, on MnK you can invest those stat points into range. Headseeker and Keep Away are the key points, but definitely keep an eye out for Arrowhead Brake to correct that recoil direction." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3103255595&perks=3619207468,460017080


// Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "In order to, in my humble opinion, get the most out of it in PvE, you'll want a base of 4 in your magazine. This way with Clown Cartridge there's a very high chance you'll be with 5 going into engagements. With Vorpal Weapon you won't need to hit crits in order to do good damage and you can take this solo without any drop in damage. Reload MW helps speed up those reloads getting you back to 4 or higher." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3871226707&perks=1546637391,2284787283


// Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Eva spoiled us last year and gave us a god roll, snapshot and opening shot, right off the rip. This year she might not be so giving. If you're looking for max handling, fluted and a handling MW will get you there. You can also opt for Smallbore / Accurized Rounds / Range MW for max range. I am a little sour that Slickdraw was removed, especially after the buff." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3871226707&perks=47981717,957782887


// Acosmic GSp
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Similar to how Geodetic HSM is the best sword for void mains, Acosmic GSp will be the best grenade launcher for void mains. Loose Change is a laughable perk on its own, but coupled with Destabilizing Rounds you won't need to rely as heavily on your abilities to get a whopping +50 reload speed. You'll be able to clear rooms with ease and be able to bridge your loadout into higher DPS weapons." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=413901114&perks=1119449540,2048641572


// Acosmic GSp
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Grenade launchers in PvP need to do two things. Hit their targets, and kill them. With high velocity coming at base with these grenade launchers you'll know your grenade gets to where it needs to go. Explosive Light will max out your blast radius and with how often you'll generate an orb the tricky part is actually securing heavy. Proximity Grenades will make this more forgiving. It might just take your heavy slot up from Wendigo." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

Rampage might not be the best but it does allow you to 3 crit 1 body any resilience and 2 crit 2 body all the way up to 7 resilience. Adrenaline Junkie isn't quite as strong on the low end. // Unending Tempest - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Unending Tempest will be the next best submachine gun. Rivaling but not as strong as release The Immortal. The only issue is the large perk pool, but you can always work around that by playing crucible for more resets. The best perks depend on how you play. Killing Wind will help you get to and beat out your next engagement, Multikill Clip works here, but Kill Clip would have been better. Dynamic Sway Reduction will help keep your bullets on target paired with Target Lock for that quick TtK. Finally you could also try to hit max range with Fragile Focus and boost up your other stats with Perpetual Motion. It's definitely going to be a dominant SMG this season, and if you prefer precision SMGs like myself it will be worth the grind." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// Eleatic Principle - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am sure by now most players have a good rapid-fire machine gun in their arsenal. Whether that's Retrofit Escapade, Planck's Stride, Recurrent Impact, Shattered Cipher, or reaching all the way back even a Thermal Erosion. That being said, the only direct competition Eleatic Principle has is with Planck's Stride, which I think Eleatic Principle blows Planck's out of the water. Eleatic has access to Golden Tricorn which is the best damage perk in the game, or if you prefer not to use an arc subclass you could go with Target Lock for a slightly different Retrofit. You won't have access to a reload or mag extending perk but you can make the shots easier to land with Zen Moment, Well Rounded, or after some kills even Heating Up." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Persuader - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did anyone want more Rapid-Fire Frame snipers? I hope so because Persuader is here and ready to take up some vault space. The best PvE option is actually a throwback repeat to one of my first "DPS" snipers. Does anyone remember the Long Shadow with Rapid Hit and Triple Tap being the best we could have in Forsaken until Black Armory introduced us to Firing Line. Persuader is the best option for the older perk combo, but is still outclassed by other snipers in the current Sandbox. Supremacy and Praedyth's Revenge are both incredible for damage, and any Firing Line sniper will compete with this one for decent damage." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Persuader - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Persuader also falls behind in the Crucible. It does have access to Surplus to reach 100 handling but you would either have to have all 3 stacks or 2 stacks with full investment into handling to maintain ability usage while keeping 100 handling. If you can maintain all your Surplus stacks and invest the rest of your stats into range you'll have 87 range and 100 handling and reload speed. Still incredible but then you remember it's a rapid-fire frame meaning you can't crit supers or double body." Recommended MW: Handling.| tags:mkb,pvp

// Deadpan Delivery - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Deadpan Delivery is a great shotgun for most players looking for a "plug and play" shotgun. Being able to have Overflow and One-Two Punch for the highest damage show followed by the most One-Two Punch... punches. The only other synergy you could have asked for is Grave Robber for instant refresh on melee kills. However, on bigger bosses that might need a few more hits than your magazine allows this could slot in perfectly. Being Arc it also has some synergy with the Hunter class and can play into blinding / amplified builds. Discord is another interesting shout as you can run around with Frenzy for full uptime on damage and always having ammo to shoot with. Barrel Constrictor is an interesting perk for PvE as it makes sure all your pellets hit but it would be better paired with One-Two Punch instead of in the same column." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Deadpan Delivery - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "I'm not going to lie. I got excited by this shotgun for one mere fact. Slickdraw. I know it's not everyone's cup of tea, but it has been mine for the past season. I have been slowly collecting Slickdraw weapons and changing crafted weapons to utilize Slickdraw. Now I know Slickdraw reduces your auto-aim cone size; it just means you have to be a bit more accurate when aiming. You can achieve a similar effect of Slickdraw by going with Arc Elemental Capacitor, Barrel Shroud, a Handling MW, and Quick Access Sling for 96 handling. This gives you a ready speed of 0.20s and an aim down sights speed of 0.23s. However just having Slickdraw drops you to the same ready speed and drops a hundredth of a second off of aim down sights. This means you can invest every other stat point into range. Bungie knew what they were doing when bringing in this weapon as Deadpan Delivery has the second lowest range stat of all Aggressive Frame shotguns even losing to the Uncommon Ded Nemoris II." Recommended MW: Handling.| tags:mkb,pvp
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1451849462,3511092054
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=2450788523,3511092054
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1451849462,1821614984
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1821614984,2450788523


// Kept Confidence - PvE (pve,mkb,controller)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Kept Confidence is getting a lot of hype but is it worth it? We have some incredible powerhouses in the same slot. Fatebringer, Austringer, Eyasluna, Spare Rations, and to a lesser extent D.F.A. and Dire Promise. What does Kept Confidence bring to the table? Well, in PvE not a whole lot. If you're constantly cycling debuffs it could be interesting, but not all subclasses have equal access to debuffs. Void warlock and hunter could be the strongest uptime with child and the smoke bomb applying debuffs. Otherwise I think this perk is mostly useless. It then leaves us with a dilemma; what is the best PvE perk on Kept Confidence for PvE? Stats for All is probably going to be your best bet. It leaves a lot to be desired, but is the best we can do. Pairing this with Collective Action or Multikill Clip are going to be your best bets. There aren't a lot of good combinations for PvE with this hand cannon." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=1583705720,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=1583705720,2458213969
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=1119449540,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=1119449540,2458213969


// Kept Confidence - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "PvP is another story. There's really only one or two ways this hand cannon can work. You can either opt for a "win more" perk like Killing Wind or a more neutral perk like Quickdraw depending on how you play. Neither are exceptionally better than the other, but the main pairing for both is Eye of the Storm. Kept Confidence could have been released as a static weapon like Epochal Integration and people would still use the same perks. Your barrel and masterwork choice is really up to preference if you want more stability, handling, or range." Recommended MW: Range or Stability. tags:mkb,pvp
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=2450788523,699525795
dimwishlist:item=1875512595&perks=699525795,706527188


// Nightshade - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Nightshade returns in its third, and hopefully, final glory. With a recoil direction of 56 you almost need Arrowhead Brake in order to fire at full RPM. In PvE I would highly recommend Flared Magwell or Light Mag depending on if you want range or stability. The added reload will feel incredible. You can then stack on Outlaw or Enlightened Action for better reload on top of that, or even Keep Away to bump out your range and handling. I find that in certain activities it is hard to keep enemies away all the time so you'll be constantly fighting whether the perk is up or not. Finally to round out the reload / damage perks you can use the easiest damage Nightshade has to offer, Collective Action. I find Kill Clip to be better as it's an ever so slightly higher damage bump. But depending on your build if you can create those elemental pickups it would be easier on Collective Action. Hatchling could work really well on Strand now that they received a slight buff." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// Nightshade - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Nightshade in PvP has had an interesting run. From being a viable option in Vanilla, to being passed over with random rolls, to being an off meta choice in its revival, to being outclassed, and finally returning again. What a ride. Arrowhead Brake is again my choice in barrels, but if you can control the recoil direction you can certainly opt for other options. Ricochet Rounds is the best in slot whenever it is available so please choose that. High-Caliber Rounds can work but I find neutrally the bump in stability outweighs possibly flinching off my opponent. In the third column it is all about Keep Away. Being able to get a range bump for free is incredible. I prefer Kill Clip for an easier time 1v2'ing as I am usually in a bad situation, but Headseeker is better neutrally for any 1vX situation as it's always on. With my roll choices you can have 100 recoil direction with a counterbalance mod and 32m of in game range. Plenty to take advantage of the bonuses of Keep Away." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:mkb,pvp

// The Showrunner - PvE (mkb,controller,pve)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Showrunner returns to us in an interesting time. I know I will be using it but that's because it can roll with an ever so elusive combination of Grave Robber and Swashbuckler. The Showrunner being the second lightweight frame with this combo and the first in the Kinetic Slot. For me this works well with all my titan builds and my titan brain. However, if you're not on a punch subclass or the master class then opting for something like Overflow and Kinetic Tremors will be a great combo. Overflow allows you to get 72 bullets per magazine, allowing for a whopping 7 Kinetic Tremor activations; and that's just at base. The only other weapon to get this combination is Buzzard but the lower magazine on Buzzard really holds it back, only getting 3 per overflow. This doesn't mean you can't get more than that by constantly walking over bricks to refill the magazine, but let's be honest I haven't done that subconsciously and I love Overflow." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:mkb,controller,pve

// The Showrunner - MKB PvP (mkb,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "In PvP The Showrunner is going to be the least used SMG this season right behind Unending Tempest. Go see why I think that SMG is better in the Vendor breakdown. The Showrunner has some great perks in Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction, Rangefinder if you're really looking for consistency at range, or more neutral perks like Well Rounded or Heating Up. However, the issue is really the frame we were given. Lightweight SMGs are not "in the spotlight." While I think this SMG can serve you well as a kinetic Funnelweb the perks to note aren't as strong. You can almost hit 100 range with Full Bore, Ricochet, Well Rounded 2x, and Fragile Focus, but that sacrifices Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction for only 23m of range." //notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "While this rocket is better than Crowning Duologue, it's because the bar was so low Semiotician almost tripped walking in this season. Semiotician has way too many vowels to be considered healthy, but has a decent enough perk tool to keep it around. Enhanced Field Prep and Enhanced Explosive Light are going to be tried and true. Thanks to one of my Patrons, we discovered with one reserve mod and enhanced Bipod you can have 15 rockets in reserves.
